newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland sells PLN 760 mln of fixed bonds at auction.
newsitem.headline: Poland sells PLN 760 mln of fixed bonds at auction.

text.p: The Polish Treasury sold on Thursday 601 million zlotys of 16 percent two-year fixed bonds, due October 12, 1998, after investors bid for 758 million of the bonds, the finance ministry said.
The Treasury also sold 159 million zlotys of 12 percent five-year bonds, due October 12, 2001, after investors bid for 295 million of the paper.
The minimum price of the two-year bonds was 93.62, up from 93.20 at last auction on July 18 and the average price was 93.85, up from 93.66.
The minimum price for the five-year paper was 80.68, up from 80.55 and the average price was 80.87, up from 80.76.
The settlement date for the shorter paper is September 5, 1996 and September 12, 1996 for the longer paper.
